title: 108_hr4550
content: The Act is titled the "Safe, Efficient, Coordinated, Unified, Revitalized, Enhanced Visa Waiver Act" and requires visa waiver participants to electronically submit biographical information. The Secretary of Homeland Security must establish an electronic system for visa waiver program participants to submit biographical information before entering the US. The system must provide an eligibility determination within 30 minutes for nonimmigrant visitors. The Secretary of Homeland Security must establish an electronic system for visa waiver program participants to submit biographical information before entering the US. The system shall include carrier obligations for inquiries and responses within 90 seconds, deployment soon after enactment, and a fee for eligible aliens. The Secretary of Homeland Security will establish a fee for aliens in the visa waiver program to cover the costs of the electronic system. Consultation with a private sector group is required for system development. The Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act requires the installation of equipment and software at all U.S. ports of entry for biometric comparison and authentication of visas, travel documents, and passports by specific deadlines. The Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act mandates technology standard implementation deadlines to be extended to 2005. Additionally, a limited good faith waiver provision is included. The Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act allows the Secretary of Homeland Security to grant up to 2 extensions for countries working towards meeting passport requirements, with each extension lasting up to 6 months. Factors considered include progress towards meeting the requirements. The Secretary of Homeland Security must consider factors certified by the Secretary of State, such as the country's efforts to meet passport requirements by specific deadlines. An initial report on countries' progress must be issued by October 26, 2005. The Secretary of Homeland Security, in consultation with the Secretary of State, must issue an initial report on countries' progress by October 26, 2005, and a final report by April 25, 2006, regarding meeting specific requirements. SEC. 6. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Section 303 of the Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act is amended to replace "Attorney General" with "Secretary of Homeland Security".
